New York City faces ongoing challenges as flu season persists, subway disruptions due to construction are set for the weekend, and Mayor Mamdani's administration sees significant personnel changes, including the appointment of Christine Clarke to lead the Human Rights Commission and the resignation of key officials.

### Risks & Alerts

- NYC flu season continues with rising cases; residents advised to take precautions. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiAFBVV95cUxPNGlrUk14MmF5TXlxZ2RRUHhqdmlnVW1PcXItRHR0YzgySEdJNDNFWW9qaVpGWjNtRzVqQWw3Nl8zMnp2MUtEVGhuNF9YLTRxV2JBdFlFSmFjLTZ0UEJIcGFkdEk2Q1djb1Qzb21jWW9fRHpYbU45MlVycWpHZ1lVakdFblBpNWdf?oc=5)
- Most MTA subway lines will face construction-related disruptions starting late Friday night. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxPcWFaRjNGcUxtUVY0SUcwaXVQd3ZRV2pUTVhvSnFpaXY0aG9RS3hLdFBXUXdFLXU0N2tkUWlpcnpPa3RwT2FzeXNHM0EtWTJYQ3cxWTBUX24zZ1k0Zmtqdy1jOW5DUGhJZjRyZ093SFNYTUlMNlJPSzg0enpNdVVSWHBfUDlabW9HaEE?oc=5)
